<project name="Helloworld" default="dist" basedir=".">

	<!-- set global properties for this build -->
	<property name="src" value="."/>
	<property name="build" value="bin/build"/>
	<property name="dist"  value="bin/dist"/>
	<property name="generated"  value="bin/generated"/>
	
	<path id="classpath">

		<pathelement path="C:\weblogic\lib\weblogicaux.jar"/>
		
	</path>

	<taskdef name="ejbdoclet" classname="xdoclet.ejb.EjbDocletTask">
			<classpath refid="classpath"/>
	</taskdef>
<!--
	<taskdef name="ejbc" classname="EJBCTask">
			<classpath refid="classpath"/>
	</taskdef>
-->        	
	<target name="init">
		<!-- Create the time stamp -->
		<tstamp/>
		<!-- Create the build directory structure used by compile -->
		<mkdir dir="${build}"/>
		<mkdir dir="${build}/META-INF"/>
		<mkdir dir="${generated}"/>
		<!--<copy file="META-INF/ejb-jar.xml" tofile="${build}/META-
INF/ejb-jar.xml"/>-->
	</target>

	<target name="ejbdoclet" depends="init">
		<ejbdoclet sourcepath="${src}" destdir="${generated}" 
ejbspec="1.1">
			<fileset dir="${src}">
			    <include name="**/HelloWorldBean.java" />
			    <exclude name="bin/**" />
			</fileset>
			<remoteinterface/>
			<homeinterface/>
			<deploymentdescriptor destdir="${build}/META-INF"/>
			<orion destdir="${build}/META-INF"/>
		</ejbdoclet>
	</target>	

	<target name="compile" depends="ejbdoclet">
		<!-- Compile the java code into ${build} -->
		<javac srcdir="${src}:${generated}" excludes="bin/**" 
destdir="${build}">
			<classpath refid="classpath"/>
		</javac>
	</target>

	<target name="dist" depends="compile">
		<!-- Create the distribution directory -->
		<mkdir dir="${dist}"/>
		<!-- Put everything into the .jar file -->
		<jar jarfile="${dist}/WLSTest.jar" basedir="${build}"/>
	</target>
<!--
	<target name="ejbc" depends="dist">

destJarFile="${dist}/finalWLSTest.jar"/>
	</target>
-->
</project>

It has to do with the way Eclipse computes plug-in classpaths. It does 
disconsiders any classpath added before Eclipse starts and computes its own 
based on the plugins and fragments. Search the newsgroup for Ant and JUnit in 
order to find a workaround for your problem (adding a fragment to 
org.eclipse.ant with the necessary jars).

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 10600 ***
